messages.message: Link to sandbox, please!
https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/anikb1nbox
Works for me?
If you sign up and register, backend services are not working, seems to be a 401.
OK, it failed when I treid to create an org. This is a platform bug, not a crafting problem. cc @Xindi Xu -- unable to create orgs (maybe also @Victor Zeng)

Logs:
```owner@dev:~$ cs logs -f core-platform
âœ” select the only one - DAEMON:core-platform@instabase
2025/08/11 15:09:33 ERROR /src/coreplatformservice/account/handler/handler.go:208 -- [INTERNAL]: Failed to set roles: code = NOT_FOUND, msg = Missing valid roles for all role uuids
2025/08/11 15:09:35 ERROR /src/coreplatformservice/account/handler/account.go:1030 -- Fail: Account with username (matt-org2) not found
2025/08/11 15:09:36 ERROR /src/coreplatformservice/account/handler/org.go:325 -- Fail: Failed to set roles: code = NOT_FOUND, msg = Missing valid roles for all role uuids
2025/08/11 15:09:36 ERROR /src/coreplatformservice/account/handler/handler.go:208 -- [INTERNAL]: Failed to set roles: code = NOT_FOUND, msg = Missing valid roles for all role uuids
2025/08/11 15:09:36 ERROR /src/coreplatformservice/account/handler/handler.go:208 -- [INTERNAL]: Failed to set roles: code = NOT_FOUND, msg = Missing valid roles for all role uuids```
Setup may not have run correctly (?)
That is strange, I spun up 2 env's both had the same issue

```mysql> select * from roles;
Empty set (0.00 sec)```
Oh 1 sec

```$IB_HOME/.sandbox/ibdev-backend/scripts/run-post-install-actions```
Looks like perhaps the post-install actions may not have run (?)
Which is odd, b/c according to the setup logs (https://instabase.sandboxes.site/logview/instabase/anikb1nbox/dev/task/setup%3ABuild%3Ainstabase) they did run
Wonder if there is a bug in the post-install-action-aihub action
Maybe? I also figure something might not be running as I have the latest code pulled up in another branch where the backend services seems to be fine.
Yep, that fixed it
It looks like the actions ran per the logs, but the state was wiped from the DB. When I ran them again, I was able to create an org.
JW, did you do a mysql snapshot/restore at any point?
Nope, These are fresh installs
@Victor Zeng / @Xindi Xu --- disregard
OK....I'll try one myself to see what happens

Aha, found this in the logs:

``` > [js-builder 3/8] RUN mkdir -p /instabase/dist:
0.457 runc run failed: unable to start container process: error during container init: error mounting "sysfs" to rootfs at "/sys": mount src=sysfs, dst=/sys, dstFd=/proc/thread-self/fd/8, flags=0xf: invalid argument
------
service.Dockerfile:50
--------------------
  48 |     
  49 |     # Create output dir
  50 | >>> RUN mkdir -p /instabase/dist
  51 |     
  52 |     # Copy source from the 'js-src' build context
--------------------
ERROR: failed to build: failed to solve: process "/bin/sh -c mkdir -p /instabase/dist" did not complete successfully: exit code: 1
make: Leaving directory '/home/owner/instabase/tools/onprem/post-install-action-aihub-license'
 Error 1```
Looks like the action failed -- some kind of docker problem :cry:
There should be a `set -e` at the top of the `run-post-install-actions` script as well
Anyway, that's what caused it. I'm not sure what the deal is, but if you run into this again, just run the actions manually as above
Thanks! Will do
